intro: Astragalus yunnanensis subsp. yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and is adapted to rocky or dry soils. It plays a role in nitrogen fixation, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitat. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct botanical features compared to other Astragalus species.
